intro: Stauranthera philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine sturain, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy, contributing to its ornamental value. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, typically in moist, shaded environments.
